intro: Amblyanthera membranacea, commonly known as the membranous anther plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique membranous anthers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and thrives in shaded, moist conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Amblyanthera membranacea is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
